name: Rose Bowl Stadium
description: The Rose Bowl Stadium, home to UCLA Bruin football and famous for hosting everything from filmings to the world’s largest flea market, has been an iconic part of Pasadena since it opened in 1922. Designed by renowned architect Myron Hunt, this legendary venue first made its mark with the inaugural Rose Bowl game on New Year’s Day in 1923. Today, it’s not just a sports haven but also a top destination for concerts and special events. Situated against the breathtaking backdrop of the San Gabriel Mountains, fans get to enjoy a spectacular view while cheering on their favorite team or catching a show. The Rose Bowl isn't just a stadium—it's a historic, must-see part of Southern California culture.
word_on_the_street:
• Non-UCLA parking: You can skip the hassle and purchase parking in advance here.

Approved bags:

  • Clear plastic bags up to 12" x 6" x 12", 1-gallon plastic freezer bags, and clutches (with shoulder or wrist straps) no larger than 4.5" x 6.5".
  • Diaper bags are permitted when accompanied by a child.
seo_title: Rose Bowl Stadium | Los Angeles | Shrtlst. Travel Guide
seo_description: Buy tickets, find more information, and get expert tips on Rose Bowl Stadium in Los Angeles. Find the best things to do, places to eat, and local-approved hotspots in Los Angeles on the Shrtlst. No reviews. Just great tips.

name: Dodger Stadium
description: Opened in 1962, Dodger Stadium, originally known as Chavez Ravine Stadium, was the brainchild of architect Emil Praeger of Praeger-Kavanagh-Waterbury, designed in close collaboration with the iconic Dodgers owner Walter O'Malley. Perched between stunning views of downtown LA to the south and the majestic San Gabriel Mountains to the north, it’s more than just a ballpark—it’s a slice of LA history. And, of course, no visit is complete without grabbing the legendary Dodger Dog, a true taste of the stadium experience. Dodger Stadium seamlessly blends timeless charm with unbeatable views, making it a must-visit for baseball fans and sightseers alike.
word_on_the_street:
• Prepaid parking: Available up until three hours before the first pitch.
  • Cashless parking: All parking transactions are cashless.
  • Permitted items that are subject to search are diaper bags accompanying infants, clear plastic bags smaller than 12”x12”x6”, non-clear wristlets/clutches no larger than 5”x8”x2”.
seo_title: Dodger Stadium | Los Angeles | Shrtlst. Travel Guide
seo_description: Buy tickets, find more information, and get expert tips on Dodger Stadium in Los Angeles. Find the best things to do, places to eat, and local-approved hotspots in Los Angeles on the Shrtlst. No reviews. Just great tips.

name: SoFi Stadium
description: Opened in 2020, what a year to make an entrance. This stunning addition to LA’s collection of world-class sports and event venues quickly made waves. SoFi Stadium, home to both the Los Angeles Rams and Chargers, was the vision of Rams Owner and Chairman E. Stanley Kroenke, at a massive 3.1 million square feet, is the largest stadium in the NFL. In 2022, it had the honor of hosting the Super Bowl, solidifying its place as a top-tier destination for major events. But SoFi Stadium is more than just a sports venue; it’s part of a cutting-edge mixed-use development featuring lifestyle, retail, commercial office space, a hotel, and over 2,000 residences. With outdoor parks and open spaces, this complex is designed to be a vibrant community hub for both entertainment and everyday living in the heart of LA.
word_on_the_street:
• Parking:
  • Prices vary based on the event.
  • Purchasing parking in advance is highly encouraged. You can do so here!
  • Bag Policy:
  • Permitted bags must be clear plastic, vinyl, or PVC and cannot exceed 12" x 6" x 12".
  • Bag valet is available during select events.
seo_title: SoFi Stadium | Los Angeles | Shrtlst. Travel Guide
seo_description: Buy tickets, find more information, and get expert tips on SoFi Stadium in Los Angeles. Find the best things to do, places to eat, and local-approved hotspots in Los Angeles on the Shrtlst. No reviews. Just great tips.

name: Smoothie King Center
description: Designed by a talented trio of architectural firms, Arthur Q. Davis and Partners, Billes-Manning Architects, and Hewitt Washington and Associates—the arena sits on a sprawling 55-acre campus as part of the Louisiana Stadium and Exposition District. Opening its doors in October of 1999, this state-of-the-art venue quickly became a centerpiece in New Orleans. Home to the New Orleans Pelicans, it’s known for its intimate yet first-class atmosphere, providing fans with an up-close experience for NBA games and premier sporting events. But the excitement doesn’t stop with sports. This versatile arena also hosts concerts, private receptions, and a variety of special events, offering a top-tier experience for every occasion. Whether you're catching a game or attending a concert, this venue continues to be a cornerstone of New Orleans entertainment.
word_on_the_street:
• Pelicans Happy Hour:
  • Available on select dates outside the Smoothie King Center.
  • Features a variety of concessions, live music, and lawn games.
  • No tickets are required for entry.
  • Bag Policy:
  • Bags, purses, backpacks, or briefcases larger than 14" x 14" x 6" are not allowed inside the Smoothie King Center.
  • Parking:
  • Seven parking garages and two surface lots are available for public use.
  • All parking is cashless.
seo_title: Smoothie King Center | New Orleans | Shrtlst. Travel Guide
seo_description: Buy tickets, find more information, and get expert tips on Smoothie King Center in New Orleans. Find the best things to do, places to eat, and local-approved hotspots in New Orleans on the Shrtlst. No reviews. Just great tips.

name: Caesars Superdome
description: Opened in 1975 and designed by the renowned architect Nathaniel C. Curtis, the Superdome, originally known as the Louisiana Superdome and formerly the Mercedes-Benz Superdome, stands as a marvel of modern engineering. As the world’s largest entirely steel-constructed arena without any obstructing posts or columns, its design offers fans an uninterrupted view of all the action. Situated in downtown New Orleans, the Superdome has become an iconic landmark, hosting some of the biggest sporting events in history, including Super Bowls, college championships, and, of course, serving as the home of the New Orleans Saints. Beyond sports, the dome also plays host to concerts, conventions, and major cultural events, making it a vibrant part of the city's pulse.
word_on_the_street:
• Permitted bags: They must be clear plastic, vinyl, or PVC and not exceed 12" x 6" x 12".
  • Includes clear backpacks, clear fanny packs, and clear cinch bags within these dimensions.
  • Parking: Seven parking garages and two surface lots are available; all are cashless.
seo_title: Caesars Superdome | New Orleans | Shrtlst. Travel Guide
seo_description: Buy tickets, find more information, and get expert tips on Caesars Superdome in New Orleans. Find the best things to do, places to eat, and local-approved hotspots in New Orleans on the Shrtlst. No reviews. Just great tips.

name: Credit Union 1 Arena
description: Credit Union 1 Arena, originally opened in 1982, has grown into one of Chicago’s versatile event hubs. With a capacity of around 10,000, this multi-purpose indoor arena hosts a wide range of functions, from thrilling concerts and sports games to conventions and community events. More than just a venue, it plays a key role in promoting the University of Illinois at Chicago (UIC) by showcasing a variety of events that highlight UIC’s educational mission while positioning the arena as a premier destination for entertainment in the city. Whether it's a sold-out show or a university gathering, Credit Union 1 Arena continues to bring diverse experiences to the heart of Chicago.
word_on_the_street:
• No re-entry policy is in effect.
  • Purses and small bags are allowed after being searched.
  • Bags and purses larger than 14″ x 14″ x 6″ will NOT be permitted inside the venue.
  • Policies are subject to change depending on the event.
  • Parking is available on UIC’s campus.
seo_title: Credit Union 1 Arena | Chicago | Shrtlst. Travel Guide

name: Soldier Field
description: Originally opened in 1924 as Municipal Grant Park Stadium, Soldier Field came to life after the architectural team of Holabird and Roche won a design competition. Just a year later, it was rebranded to honor U.S. soldiers, transforming into a living memorial to their service. Soldier Field quickly became a symbol of national pride and, during the "Golden Age of Sports," one of the country's premier venues. In 1968, it gained historical significance as the birthplace of the first Special Olympic Games. Home to both the Chicago Bears and Chicago Fire FC, the stadium boasts a natural grass field and a prime lakefront location, hosting countless legendary moments. Whether for football, soccer, concerts, or cultural events, Soldier Field stands as a cherished part of Chicago’s sports and architectural legacy.
word_on_the_street:
• Permitted bags must be clear plastic, vinyl, or PVC and cannot exceed 12” x 6” x 12” (or 30.5 x 15.25 x 30.5 cm).
  • This includes clear backpacks, clear fanny packs, and clear cinch bags within these dimensions.
  • Diaper bags must also be clear.
  • Parking can be reserved in advance for a smoother visit.
  • Shuttle service is available exclusively for Chicago Bears games from McCormick Place and Millennium Park Garage.
seo_title: Soldier Field | Chicago | Shrtlst. Travel Guide
seo_description: Buy tickets, find more information, and get expert tips on Soldier Field in Chicago. Find the best things to do, places to eat, and local-approved hotspots in Chicago on the Shrtlst. No reviews. Just great tips.

name: United Center
description: The United Center, home to both the Chicago Blackhawks and the Chicago Bulls, stands as the largest arena in the United States. Opened in 1994, it has become a hub for more than just sports, hosting over 200 events each year, including concerts, shows, and special events. The arena was born out of a vision in 1988 when William Wirtz, owner of the Blackhawks, and Jerry Reinsdorf, chairman of the Bulls, teamed up to create a cutting-edge venue that would revolutionize the sports experience as they prepared to enter the 21st century. Their partnership resulted in a state-of-the-art arena that continues to set the stage for some of the most exciting moments in both sports and entertainment, solidifying its place as a Chicago landmark.
word_on_the_street:
• Guests may bring a small purse or personal bag up to 10" x 6" x 2" into the arena.
  • Backpacks and larger bags are not allowed.
  • Parking costs typically range between $15-$20, but prices may vary based on demand.
  • The United Center is a fully cashless arena, so be sure to have your card or mobile payment ready!
seo_title: United Center | Chicago | Shrtlst. Travel Guide
seo_description: Buy tickets, find more information, and get expert tips on United Center in Chicago. Find the best things to do, places to eat, and local-approved hotspots in Chicago on the Shrtlst. No reviews. Just great tips.

name: Lazy Bird
description: This cozy cocktail and music lounge will have you tapping your feet and swaying to the smooth sounds of jazz, rock, and soul in no time. Lazy Bird was designed as a nod to what makes Chicago tick: good music and even better vibes. From Thursday to Saturday, they invite some of the best musicians around, both local legends and some familiar faces passing through—to keep the party going strong. The menu, with its impressive lineup of over 50 cocktails, is a tribute to the city’s rich history, served up in a speakeasy-like atmosphere that’ll make you feel like you’ve scored a VIP ticket to the coolest underground scene. Hidden in the cellar of The Hoxton, Lazy Bird is the perfect spot to rack up some serious brownie points on date night—or just jazz up your evening. (See what we did there?)
word_on_the_street: A bit tricky to find, but that’s part of the charm—remember, it’s tucked away on the lower level. The intimate vibe makes it perfect for smaller groups looking to soak in the atmosphere, but if you’re rolling with a crowd, you might find it tough to snag enough space for everyone. It’s all part of what makes this spot feel like a hidden gem, ideal for cozy get-togethers where you can enjoy the music, cocktails, and laid-back speakeasy vibes without the hustle of a big party scene.
seo_title: Lazy Bird | Chicago | Shrtlst. Travel Guide
seo_description: Buy tickets, find more information, and get expert tips on Lazy Bird in Chicago. Find the best things to do, places to eat, and local-approved hotspots in Chicago on the Shrtlst. No reviews. Just great tips.

name: Green Mill Cocktail Lounge
description: The Green Mill is a genuine glimpse into Chicago’s Prohibition past, where jazz legends played, and Al Capone had his own booth. With its velvet-curtained stage, vintage posters, and a bar that's been around for over a century, it feels like stepping back in time. The cocktails are strong, the live jazz keeps the room buzzing, and the history is palpable. Once partially owned by “Machine Gun” McGurn and under Capone’s control, it's a spot where true crime fans and history buffs can soak in the atmosphere. The Green Mill isn’t just a bar; it’s a piece of Chicago’s soul.
word_on_the_street: Stop by on a Sunday night for the Poetry Slam! It’s become a bit of a hidden gem at this old-school spot. The atmosphere is raw, with talented poets taking the stage and giving the place a fresh, modern vibe while still holding onto its history. And who knows, as the jazz plays into the night, you might feel the ghost of Capone tipping his hat to the music and the energy that still fills the room. It’s a cool blend of the past and present that makes for a unique night out.
seo_title: Green Mill Cocktail Lounge | Chicago | Shrtlst. Travel Guide
seo_description: Buy tickets, find more information, and get expert tips on Green Mill Cocktail Lounge in Chicago. Find the best things to do, places to eat, and local-approved hotspots in Chicago on the Shrtlst. No reviews. Just great tips.

name: Garfield Park Conservatory
description: Hidden within Chicago’s Garfield Park, the Garfield Park Conservatory feels like you’ve stumbled right into Jumanji. This glass-encased wonderland is a tropical oasis with a touch of Windy City grit, featuring lush fern rooms, exotic cacti, and a palm house that might have you checking for coconuts. Open year-round, it’s the perfect escape to get your nature fix, even when the city is in full-on deep freeze mode. Established in 1908, the conservatory spans 12 acres, inside and out, making it one of the largest and most stunning botanical treasures in the country.
word_on_the_street: Admission is free, but if you’re feeling generous, donations are always welcome! Even a little bit goes a long way in keeping this special place running and making sure the community can keep enjoying it. Any contribution helps curious students around the city keep learning and exploring. It’s a sweet way to give back and keep the fun and discovery going for everyone!
seo_title: Garfield Park Conservatory | Chicago | Shrtlst. Travel Guide
seo_description: Buy tickets, find more information, and get expert tips on Garfield Park Conservatory in Chicago. Find the best things to do, places to eat, and local-approved hotspots in Chicago on the Shrtlst. No reviews. Just great tips.

name: AIRE Ancient Baths- Chicago
description: Tucked in the West Side, Aire Bath House isn’t just a spa; it’s a transcendental trip back to ancient Rome. Picture this: candlelit stone pools, aromatherapy-infused steam, and the kind of serenity only a hidden oasis in the Windy City can offer. Chicago’s Aire location is the largest, with over 20,000 square feet, five pools, two steam rooms, and plenty of dimly lit treatment rooms for massages and rituals. Set in a restored 19th-century factory that retains much of its original charm, Aire blends history and relaxation. Enjoy a peaceful soak in the thermal baths or indulge in a soothing massage. Either way, it’s the perfect escape for pure indulgence.
word_on_the_street: For those who are fully at ease with their bodies, Aire does have one little requirement: bathing suits are mandatory. But don’t worry, they’ve got you covered (literally) if you forget to bring one, so there’s no stress. The best part? Their special pools are gentle on fabrics, so your bathing suit won’t fade, no matter how many dips you take. So, while you may have to suit up, you can still enjoy the luxurious experience without sacrificing style!
seo_title: AIRE Ancient Baths- Chicago | Chicago | Shrtlst. Travel Guide
seo_description: Buy tickets, find more information, and get expert tips on AIRE Ancient Baths- Chicago in Chicago. Find the best things to do, places to eat, and local-approved hotspots in Chicago on the Shrtlst. No reviews. Just great tips.

name: Field Museum
description: The Field Museum, which first opened its doors in 1894, has since grown into a true treasure trove of natural history, with a collection that now boasts nearly 40 million artifacts and specimens. As you wander through its massive stone halls, you'll encounter everything from towering dinosaur skeletons to ancient Egyptian tombs, rare gems, and some of the world’s most unique species. It’s like stepping into a time machine without the worry of disrupting history, offering a chance to explore prehistoric creatures and distant civilizations. Over the years, the museum’s mission has expanded as well, making it a place where history, science, and culture come together for everyone to enjoy. Whether you're drawn to ancient wonders or curious about Earth’s natural mysteries, the Field Museum offers a journey through time that’s as awe-inspiring as it is laid-back, perfect for discovering at your own pace.
word_on_the_street: If you're a hardworking teacher, good news! Basic admission is complimentary for Illinois teachers. Show your employee ID when grabbing tickets in person, and voilà, you will have a FREE day at the museum on your well-deserved day off. You might even run into one of your students (bonus points if you do), or if you're really in need of a break, fingers crossed you don’t!
seo_title: Field Museum | Chicago | Shrtlst. Travel Guide
seo_description: Buy tickets, find more information, and get expert tips on Field Museum in Chicago. Find the best things to do, places to eat, and local-approved hotspots in Chicago on the Shrtlst. No reviews. Just great tips.

name: Chicago River Architecture Tour
description: Step into an architecture lover’s paradise! Take in Chicago's stunning skyline as you explore its iconic architectural gems. Sip on your favorite drink while passing landmarks like the Chicago Riverwalk, the Lyric Opera, and the Michigan Avenue Bridge. There’s so much to see, but the rest is best experienced firsthand. Whether you're a visitor or a local eager to learn more about your city, this journey reveals the creativity behind Chicago’s one-of-a-kind architecture and gives you plenty to show off when you head home!
word_on_the_street: Opting for the sunset tour is hands down the way to go. If you and the sun aren’t exactly friends, this is your perfect escape. As the golden hour sweeps over the city, the skyline comes alive in a whole new way, bathed in hues of orange and pink. It’s like watching the city get a kiss goodnight, and trust me, it’s a view that will steal your breath and leave you in awe. Plus, who doesn’t love a sunset that’s easy on the eyes and perfect for photos?
seo_title: Chicago River Architecture Tour | Chicago | Shrtlst. Travel Guide
seo_description: Buy tickets, find more information, and get expert tips on Chicago River Architecture Tour in Chicago. Find the best things to do, places to eat, and local-approved hotspots in Chicago on the Shrtlst. No reviews. Just great tips.

name: SOS Chefs
description: A culinary treasure trove trusted by chefs like Daniel Boulud and David Chang should give you an indication of the sheer variety of spices, ingredients, and offerings this little Alphabet City storefront has. Smoked soy sauce, anyone? SOS Chefs on the Lower East Side is where top chefs and home cooks alike come for rare spices, exotic ingredients, and unique kitchen tools. The offerings at SOS Chefs make for great souvenirs and gifts.
word_on_the_street: Make sure to triple-check SOS Chef’s hours before you head out, as they can change frequently. We’d hate for you to miss out on this fantastic experience just because of a timing mix-up. A quick check will ensure you can enjoy all the culinary delights without a hitch!

seo_description: Buy tickets, find more information, and get expert tips on SOS Chefs in New York. Find the best things to do, places to eat, and local-approved hotspots in New York on the Shrtlst. No reviews. Just great tips.

name: New York Transit Museum
description: The New York Transit Museum is a must-visit museum located in a decommissioned subway station in Brooklyn. It offers a fascinating look at the history of one of the world's first subway systems. Perfect for families and anyone intrigued by NYC's storied past (because all the coolest people are), the museum features subway cars from the 1930s to today. And don’t worry—you can explore the exhibits in a safe, calm environment, far from the hustle and bustle of a typical NYC transit experience. But hey, it’s as authentic as it gets!
word_on_the_street: We know you’re excited to dive into your transit knowledge, but the museum kindly asks that you arrive no more than five minutes before your reservation time. Also, remember that you’ll have a 30-minute window to enter for your reservation!
seo_title: New York Transit Museum | New York | Shrtlst. Travel Guide
seo_description: Buy tickets, find more information, and get expert tips on New York Transit Museum in New York. Find the best things to do, places to eat, and local-approved hotspots in New York on the Shrtlst. No reviews. Just great tips.

name: The Whitney
description: If you’re a fan of contemporary art, the Whitney Museum of American Art is an absolute gem you can’t miss, living in the vibrant Meatpacking District. With its ever-evolving exhibitions showcasing cutting-edge American art, you’re in for a visual treat. The museum’s thoughtfully curated displays highlight both emerging and established artists. Don’t miss the rooftop terrace—it offers some seriously breathtaking views of the city and the Hudson River. Plus, the Whitney's stunning architectural design, courtesy of Renzo Piano, adds a touch of modern flair to your visit. And who doesn't like a little flair?
word_on_the_street: Visit on Friday evenings when admission is pay-what-you-wish or FREE if you're not into donations. After soaking in the art, treat yourself to a delicious custard from Shake Shack next door and enjoy a leisurely stroll along the High Line to wrap up your evening. Just a heads-up: even though admission is free, tickets are still required since capacity is limited. So grab yours in advance and make the most of your night!
seo_title: The Whitney | New York | Shrtlst. Travel Guide
seo_description: Buy tickets, find more information, and get expert tips on The Whitney in New York. Find the best things to do, places to eat, and local-approved hotspots in New York on the Shrtlst. No reviews. Just great tips.

name: New York Botanical Gardens
description: Located in the Bronx, the New York Botanical Garden is a stunning 250-acre oasis that offers an escape into nature just minutes from the city. With over a million plants and beautifully curated gardens, it's a perfect spot for a peaceful stroll or a day of exploration. Highlights include the Enid A. Haupt Conservatory, seasonal exhibits like the Orchid Show, and the serene Native Plant Garden. Whether you're a plant enthusiast or just looking for a tranquil retreat, this botanical garden is a must-visit.
word_on_the_street: A subway ride or Metro North train ride gets you to this lush escape from the city, the New York Botanical Garden. The expansive grounds can (and should) be explored year-round, with seasonal exhibits like the Orchid Show from mid-February to mid-April not to be missed. Plan to spend at least a few hours here, especially during peak bloom seasons. Try to grab a sandwich on Arthur Avenue in the Bronx beforehand for a picnic in the gardens. The south entrance has plenty of tables and chairs to dine at and people-watch.
seo_title: New York Botanical Gardens | New York | Shrtlst. Travel Guide
seo_description: Buy tickets, find more information, and get expert tips on New York Botanical Gardens in New York. Find the best things to do, places to eat, and local-approved hotspots in New York on the Shrtlst. No reviews. Just great tips.

name: Harry Potter and the Cursed Child
description: This magical show must be seen to be believed! When Harry Potter’s head-strong son Albus befriends the son of his fiercest rival, Draco Malfoy, it sparks an unbelievable new journey for them all—with the power to change the past and future forever. Prepare for epic battles, amazing spells live on stage, and the return of many of the beloved characters from the novels as they race through time! You'll be baffled as you try to figure out how they did it!
word_on_the_street: Level up your magical experience with the VIP Ambassador Lounge Package! Enjoy a special room from the crowds, private restrooms, dedicated bar service, a special gift, and a complimentary coat check before the performance and during intermission—all designed by the same artistic wizards who brought the world of Harry Potter to life on stage. Form more information, email LyricLounge@theambassadors.com!

name: Hadestown
description: Welcome to Hadestown, way down under the ground, where even a simple song can change your fate. Winner of 8 Tony Awards including Best Musical and the Grammy Award for Best Musical Theater Album, this musical is derived from the mythic tales of Orpheus & Eurydice and Hades & Persephone-- combining American Folk and New Orleans Jazz to create a one-of-a-kind tale for the ages. Journey to the Underworld and back (hopefully), while the show asks you to imagine how the world could be... Instead of how it is.
word_on_the_street:

name: Moulin Rouge! The Musical
description: Enter a world of romance and splendor, of eye-popping excess, of glitz, grandeur, and glory! Bohemians, aristocrats, and others revel in electrifying enchantment together as Baz Luhrmann’s revolutionary film comes to life onstage - remixed in a new musical mash-up extravaganza. Moulin Rouge! The Musical is a theatrical celebration of Truth, Beauty, Freedom, and — above all — Love. Beginning July 23, you will even witness some of the original opening cast and a very familiar face in Aaron Tveit returning as Christian and Joanna “JoJo” Levesque starring as Satine for a 12-week limited engagement!

name: The Outsiders
description: Adapted from S.E. Hinton's famous novel and Francis Ford Coppola's iconic film, The Outsiders tells the story of Ponyboy Curtis, Johnny Cade, and their chosen family of "outsiders" as they navigate a quest for purpose and who they want to become in a world that may never accept them. This is a story by a teenager about teenagers for teenagers. It is a tale of bonds, friendships, and the family ties we create in an attempt to protect what's ours and fight for what could be... In the end, there may still be "lots of good in the world."
word_on_the_street:

name: Cabaret
description:
Willkommen. Bienvenue. Welcome to Cabaret, the Musical, and (more importantly) the Kit Kat Club. Known for its hedonistic nightlife and seedy atmosphere, this club invites its patrons of 1930s Berlin to step inside their world and ignore what's happening outside as the Nazis rise to power. The musical itself revolves around American writer Clifford Bradshaw (Ato Blankson-Wood) and his relations to one of the cabaret performers, Sally Bowles (Gayle Rankin) in a time of immense political change... And let's not forget the Master of Ceremonies, our Emcee (Eddie Redmayne), who oversees all the action throughout the story.

This revival has garnered enormous amounts of attention since its opening for both the show itself and the experience that it provides from the moment you walk through the doors of the theatre - inviting artists, performers, misfits, and outsiders to rule the night. So step inside their world! This is Berlin. Relax. Loosen up. Be yourself.
word_on_the_street:
Special Experiences:

There are three different packages offered to spice up your experience at the theatre for the performance. From VIP dining to your stage-side seat to exclusive access to the pre-show performances, you can discover all your options and extra information HERE! 


What to Expect:

  • Arrive at least an hour before showtime to enjoy the prologue, which features dancers and actors performing throughout the Kit Kat Club
  • Ushers will be placing stickers over every audience member’s phone camera when they enter the theatre
  • Servers offer cherry schnapps to guests upon arrival, and you can buy more drinks at the bar during the prologue and intermission
  • Guests enter the Kit Kat Club via an alleyway, with an alternate accessible entrance also available

name: The Great Gatsby
description: Return to the glamourous 1920s with a new musical adaptation of F. Scott Fitzgerald’s beloved novel of wealth, class, and the American Dream. Starring Jeremy Jordan (Newsies) as the eccentric and mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and Eva Noblezada (Hadestown) as the enigmatic and beautiful Daisy Buchanan, The Great Gatsby sheds light on the complexities of social class and the consequences of obsession. With choreography by Dominique Kelley (So You Think You Can Dance) and an original score by Jason Howland (Little Women) and Nathan Tysen (Paradise Square) you definitely won't want to miss this party!
word_on_the_street:
Digital Lottery Tickets & Rush Tickets:

  • A limited number of $45 tickets will be available for each performance via digital lottery.
  • The lottery will open at 12 AM one day before the performance and close at 3 PM.
  • Winners are drawn at 10 AM and 3 PM one day before the performance. They will be notified by email shortly after each drawing and have five hours to claim and purchase tickets online. To enter, Click Here!
  • Rush Tickets are available on the day of the performance. One person may buy up to two tickets for $40 each (or $25 each with a valid student ID).

name: Housing Works
description: With 11 locations across NYC, Housing Works offers an eclectic mix of designer, vintage, and contemporary fashion, plus furniture, jewelry, and unique collectibles. For over 30 years, this iconic thrift store has not only been a treasure trove for style seekers but also a force for good, using fashion to fight HIV and homelessness. Beyond the racks and shelves, they’re leading social justice efforts nationwide, making every purchase a part of something bigger.
word_on_the_street: Housing Works strongly advocates for sexual health, offering support to help you take charge on your own terms. From testing to medication, their providers are dedicated to caring for the community and ensuring access to essential health services.
